text: Rudolph "Rudy" Van Gelder (November 2, 1924 â€“ August 25, 2016) was an American recording engineer who specialized in jazz.The Washington Post: Rudy Van Gelder, audio engineer who helped shape venerated jazz recordings, dies at 91 - The Washington Post, accessdate: September 1, 2016 He has been described as the most important recording engineer of jazz.[ "Rudy Van Gelder"] by Steve Huey for AllMusic.com; accessed 31 July 2007 Over a period of more than 50 years, Van Gelder recorded several thousand jazz sessions. Some of these recordings are recognized as classics. He recorded many of the great jazz musicians, including John Coltrane, Miles Davis, Thelonious Monk, Sonny Rollins, Art Blakey, Joe Henderson, Freddie Hubbard, Wayne Shorter, and Horace Silver. He worked with many record companies but was most closely associated with Blue Note Records. ==References== Category:2016 deaths Category:Engineers from New Jersey Category:American audio engineers Category:1924 births
